title: From John O'Groats to Land's End; Or, 1372 miles on foot; A book of days and chronicle of adventures by two pedestrians on tour
author: Naylor, John Anderton
snippet: The houses in Liskeard were built of stone, and the finest perhaps wasthat known as Stuart House, so named because King Charles I stayed therefor about a week in 1644. This was of course in the time of the CivilWar, when Cornwall, as it practically belonged to the King or his son,did not consider itself as an ordinary county, but as a duchy, and wasconsequently always loyal to the reigning sovereign.
